TrainingDetailsVTwo.Name: SEO Group
TrainingDetailsVTwo.Title: SEO Group
TrainingDetailsVTwo.Abstract: An optional set of metadata for search engine optimization (SEO).
TrainingDetailsVTwo.BodyCopy:
The Search Engine Optimization (SEO) group contains optional metadata about a page that will help search engines comprehend and rank this page appropriately. Most authors will never need to use this area, as the title and abstract are automatically used, when appropriate.

Proper Use

Only modify what you must.

Browser Bar Title

The Browser Bar Title is typically displayed in the browser's window and bookmarks, and as the link in search results. Titles deserve careful thought. They represent this page at a glance.

If empty, the Browser Bar Title field uses the page's Title.

How to write a good title.

Meta Description

The Meta Description field describes this page to search engines. This description is displayed in search results.

If empty, the Meta Description field uses the page's Abstract.

No Follow

Activate the No Follow setting to instruct search engines to ignore all the links on this page. Otherwise, search engines to also visit the links and index those.

Activate No Follow if the links on this page are not representative of your office, or may include content that you specifically don't want to be affiliated with.

No Index

Activate the No Index setting to instruct search engines to ignore this page and not return it in search results.
